Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: DiscusNJ
Reviews.Content: Hotel Prati is close to St Peters which worked out great because we went to visit St Peters each day. The staff was very helpful, especially Fabio. The room was comfortable and a little small but this is not uncommon. We had an unpleasant experience with a taxi from the airport to the hotel. Fabio suggested we take the bus back. This was a great idea. The bus stop was 800m away and for 8 Euro to the airport, we could not have been happier. Breakfast was fine - pastries and coffee or hot chocolate. The hotel even had computers in a common room which was much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Love our home away from home, Hotel Prati!”
Reviews.Author: jtfs792
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a fantastic stay in Rome and Hotel Prati was part of our fabulous vacation experience. From the moment we arrived and our name and keys were greeted at the front desk, Luigi, Franco and the staff made us feel so welcome and at home. The room was a little small but no different from other European hotels, it was perfect for my family with a bunkbed and a queen size. We woke to free breakfast and excellent Cappuccinos downstairs courtesy of the hotel. Luigi paid special attention to my children by holding donuts for them for the next day. We even got discounts to the local restaurant with amazing authentic food and pizza. The location of the hotel was perfect too because you could walk to all the major attractions or hop on the Metro or buses. It literally was 2-3 blocks away from Vatican City and we were there for the Easter festivities. What an experience! For the price, location and service you cannot go wrong. Luigi and Franco, thank you for all of your help and a wonderful experience! We will be back again to Hotel Prati in the future!

Reviews.Title: “great price for a lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: surfmam
Reviews.Content: We recently spent four nights at the Prati in Rome. We found this place totally randomly after our first accommodation fell through (very long and exhausting story). The people at the Prati were very friendly and helped get us set up (two adults and two kids, 11 and 13). The hotel is 5 minutes from the Vatican and 15 -30 minutes to the various historical sites depending on where you want to go. Also there are bus lines that take you directly to Colosseum and other sites. The neighborhood is not overly touristy, with lots of restaurants filled with locals around, but also very accommodating to tourists like us. The hotel itself is small and immaculate. They serve an fairly simple breakfast. Overall, we felt it was a lovely place to stay at a very good price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place/great location”
Reviews.Author: RHSRebel
Reviews.Content: Hotel Prati is a solid hotel; it was very clean; shower was very cramped; front office desk was very cordial and helpful; they had not promoted any sort of a free breakfast in any of their materials nor even when we checked in but we found out on the next to last day that they did offer a free breakfast each morning. Short, five minute walk to the Vatican; restaurants and shops all right there for easy access; subway stop (Ottiavano) is about 6-7 minute walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Robin1250
Reviews.Content: My husband and I reserved a room at the Hotel Prati in September because the B&B where we usually stay did not have a vacancy. We stayed for two nights at the beginning of our trip and again on the last night before we flew home (we were able to reserve a room before checking out the first time). The hotel is fabulous. Because we stayed there twice we were able to sleep in two different rooms and both were great - sparkling clean with nice bathrooms and very comfortable beds. The first room had no view at all but we were so tired we didn't care. Breakfast is served in a little room downstairs and there's also a computer that's available to guests in an area off the lobby (although they also offer free wi-fi). The staff at the front desk was very nice - always pleasant and helpful. The Hotel Prati is located in a quiet (meaning not super tourist-y) neighborhood with some wonderful little restaurants and just a short walk to the subway. We come to Rome fairly often and will definitely stay here from now on and will recommend it to others without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Vatican Christmas celebrations”
Reviews.Author: FolkWorldTravelers
Reviews.Content: We booked one night at the Hotel Prati since we needed accommodations just for Christmas Eve. For those of you who hope to attend the Christmas Eve service at St. Peter's or the next day's Pope blessing, a close hotel location is essential since it is next to impossible to find transportation once the service is out at midnight. Hotel Prati is literally 5 blocks from the Vatican. So, we booked our room (triple) and it was perfect at a very reasonable cost. The room was very clean, small but efficient, the beds were comfortable (sheets/duvet), TV included BBC news channel (only English channel), and the bathroom equipped with all essentials. Free WIFI and breakfast was included in the room rate. The staff were so kind to make calls on our behalf while we were at the hotel trying to locate our missing luggage with the responsible airlines. They called taxis on Christmas Day for us and even offered to hold our luggage in their lobby closets for free after check-out. They were exceptionally friendly which was appreciated. So, in summary, plan your next Christmas vacation in Rome and plan to stay at this hotel. Request your Papal Service tickets in advance (they are free and do not expect to find any tickets on Christmas Eve) and enjoy the inspiring Christmas Eve service and then you can easily walk to your hotel to have a good night's sleep to hear the Pope's speech/blessing the next morning. Hotel Prati was the best idea we had for the entire trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: Carol H
Reviews.Content: A really comfortable hotel, situated in a perfect location. We were litterally 2 minutes away from the Vatican City!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Bibielgato
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this nice small hotel for 10 nights earlier this month and it was great! the location is a few minutes from Vatican City and conveniently close to other sites and a metro station. The rooms are avergae size by European standards and are spotless. We fund the staff to always be friandly and helpful. They gave us some good tips for some visits as well as helping us find retaurants if we asked. We really enjoyed the quiet residential surrounding although central location. There is a very nice wine bar next door that serves very good food and the area has a lot of restaurants and grocery stores as well as all services you would find in a residential neighbourhood. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, sometimes very poor attitude”
Reviews.Author: JuliaUstinov
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an ultra-quiet neighbourhood close to the Vatican. The room was clean and had a nice view of some nearby balconies. The check in was easy.The cost was suprisingly reasonable. The hotel has a lot of statuary that give it a pleasant ambience. My room was microscopic but had a little foyer with steps down to a narrow bedroom and up to narrow, well-equipped bathroom. It was sometimes friendly and sometimes infuriatingly brusque depending on which desk clerk was on duty. The only Internet connection is in the guest lobby. I quietly skyped my family from there and the clerk hissed at me to keep the "noise" down. A short while later he had a soccer game blasting at the desk. He at least had the grace to be embarassed for an instant when I pointed out the unfairness of his behaviour but I saw the same behaviour again and again here.The desk clerks sometimes left a lot to be desired in their attitude. During my brief stay,I witnessed other issues of concern that were handled poorly by the desk staff some of whom were shockingly disrepectful. This hotel was a good value but the possibility of theft is probably a reality in many Roman venues. USE THE IN-ROOM SAFE! There is a very nice shopping district nearby on Via Cola di Rienzo. The metro is a short walk and keenwalkers can easily find their way to the main sights of classic Rome from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Looking forward to our third trip back to this gem of an hotel!”
Reviews.Author: amanda m
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed here and we weren;t disappointed. This is a fab wee hotel. Spotlessly clean, staff super friendly and helpful and delicious pastries for breakfast. Rooms are compact but who spends their days in hotels when there is so much in rome to explore? Great location too, quiet residential area (away from tourist throngs!) and yet easy walk 15mins to piazza navona and even quicker to vatican. Cannot recommend it highly enough, superb value for money.

Reviews.Title: “One night stay over”
Reviews.Author: kiwigal
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for one night as needed somewhere cheap to stay before starting my tour of Italy. I booked online and had no trouble when I checked in later at night about 9.30pm. I later read that the reception is 24 hours. I travelled solo so booked a room for one person. the room was on the 4th floor but there is a tiny and mean tiny lift which you and your bag will just fit in. The room was good and clean had everything I needed and wanted. Free wi fi which was good and the password to acess the wifi is in the little booklet of info about the hotel. THere is a free breakfast in the breakfast room which you are welcome to take back to your room. I had a pastry but saw others having pastries, biscuits and coffee. Check in and out very simple. Would stay here again if my first choice was not available.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay; great location!”
Reviews.Author: AlyssaFI
Reviews.Content: Hotel Prati is wonderfully located for those seeking to avoid the queues at St Peter's and the Vatican, given that it is a mere five minute walk away. It is also well-located by metro to all other major attractions, the metro being a five minut walk as well (and trams under two minutes!). The rooms were spotless and well-maintained, air conditioned, and breakfast was included. The beds weren't overly comfortable but that's hardly a major flaw. Internet was also free in the lobby, and wifi throughout. Service was friendly. All in all, perfect for a sightseeing trip to rome, at a fantastically low price (80 for two people). I honestly have no complaints at all and would return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, small and personal hotel”
Reviews.Author: goyourownway
Reviews.Content: N41°54'20.93" E12°27'41.32" Hotel Prati, in the Prati neighborhood close to the Vatican, is a small hotel. Our room, 116, during our stay in June of 2011 was probably the smallest of the hotel, with a very small shower. Did we care? No. The room was clean and the bed was good. Breakfast is a pastry, juice and excellent coffee. The staff is very friendly and helped use in the morning with dinner reservations in the best Roman restaurants. Prices average an European hotel room. For our next stay the staff offers a discount, if we send a booking request by email at info@hotelprati-roma.com.

Reviews.Title: “Great Roman spot”
Reviews.Author: Skiwithjill
Reviews.Content: Fantastic time at the Prati! I knew when I booked it that it was close to the Vatican, but even still, I was impressed with its location once we got there. Not only is it close to one of the world's most awe-inspiring places, but it is also in just a nice, normal-feeling Roman neighbourhood. Our room was a fine size (bigger than other comparable ones we've stayed at in Europe), and was well appointed and clean; staff was friendly and helpful. We'd be happy to stay there again, and in fact, are planning to!

Reviews.Title: “Good value in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: PDXjackson
Reviews.Content: My husband and stayed in the Hotel Prati with a group of friends in July 2010. It's an excellent location for walking to the Vatican as well as to the major sights in Rome. The price is very good. Our room was small but very clean and we slept well. Our friends had air conditioning trouble and a leaking refrigerator, but the both cases the staff was quick to move them to another room.

Reviews.Title: “excellent Rome value”
Reviews.Author: 11elevenexperience
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great bang for your buck. In a nice area, simple rooms , beds not plush yet comfortable (think, staying in the bed at nonna's house) plus nice bed-ware. I think that the most important thing when you are going budget on a hotel is cleanliness and the rooms here are so clean you could eat off the floor! great wireless internet, pastries for breakfast & Fabio on the desk is also very helpful. I would stay again. Also if you decide to catch the train from FCO airport to the Termini station and then on to your destination instead of a taxi, beware that the metro's have alot of stairs..if there is a bus heading your way from The Termini then i would recommend that, the buses are frequent and easy to travel on.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: LeneKaergaard
Reviews.Content: This small 2** hotel is located within 10 min of walking distance to St.Peter's Basilica/Vatican City. Close to Ottaviani Metro station, but also easy to walk to all the big attractions; Castel St.Angelo, Piazza Navona, Campo dei Fiori, Trastevere etc. Breakfast was included, and was as promised in our booking, just a croissant, coffee/the and juice. But it was sufficient to start the day on. I would definately stay here again next time I go to Rome - which I will!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully comfortable”
Reviews.Author: chsull90
Reviews.Content: Don't let only two-stars fool you...the rooms in Hotel Prati are extremely comfortable. If I had to guess, the hotel doesn't have three or four stars simply because it lacks unimportant amenities, such as room service and laundry service. The rooms appear to have been newly renovated. There's free wireless internet and several computers available to guests at no additional cost. Breakfast was also included, but I never went. The hotel is in the perfection location for anybody whose primary purpose in Rome is to visit the Vatican. In addition, Castel Sant'Angelo is very near by, and the Lepanto metro stop is only a few blocks away. From this station, one can access all the other parts of Rome easily. The neighborhood, Prati, is also a big plus. I highly recommend Hotel Prati.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: stout5710
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travelled to Rome for our Honeymoon and this is one of the three places that we stayed in Italy. The location of Hotel Prati was spectacular. It is just a few minutes walk from the Vatican and isn't that far from everything else. The breakfast was what we expected staying in Rome (as compared to American breakfasts - this consisted of pastries and coffee and juice). A nice unexpected surprise was the free internet that they provide in the lower level. It was a little different having to hand they keys to the front desk when you left, but we got used to that. At least we couldn't lose our keys that way. Speaking of the front desk - they were great. They were extremely nice (even though we don't speak Italian well at all) and made us feel really welcome there. The room was quite small but it was clean and not that bad. The two suitcases we had didn't fit too well but we only stepped on them a couple times (thanks to the Pub across the street). Speaking of - the Pub across the street in the lower level of that building is a lot of fun. It was one of the top rated in our guide book and fortunately (or unfortunately, depending on how you look at it) it was right across the street! We would recommend Prati and probably stay there again - the price was right, the location was excellent and the hotel was nice and clean and, as my wife put it, "cute."

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to land after a day sightseeing.”
Reviews.Author: EchterAmi
Reviews.Content: I was traveling solo in Rome at the end of a business trip and wanted to at least get a full day of sightseeing in. I was not interested in frills, or a lot of services, just in having a good place to stay. At check-in I found the front desk staff to be friendly, and they were kind when faced with my limited Italian skills. Check-in was quick and efficient, and I was given a very good map of Rome with directions to Vatican City and a couple other points of interest outlined for me at my request. The maid service was well-done, my room was very clean when I checked in, and the breakfast was laid out and accessible. It wasn't a continental breakfast with a large spread, but that wasn't what I was exepecting to begin with, and it was nice to sit and drink a cup of coffee and eat a pastry whle I looked at my day's plan. The hotel has a very European feel to it, in that great work has been done to maximize the efficiency of the existing floorplan, and I liked the layout. My room was very small, and had just the basics, but was nice. I didn't need anything other than a bed and facilities, and the room was actually well done for a solo traveler. The shower was a bit on the small side, but was a shower wand, so it worked well. The towels were different, in that they were of an absorbent material other than the traditional terrycloth. I'm not sure what they were made of, but they worked for me just fine, they were just different. I'm mostly bald, so I can't speak to the condition of the hairdryer, but it appeared to be newer. The bathroom's tile job was nicely done, and it was neat and clean. The bed was firm and comfortable, and I was able to rest well. There was the sound of traffic outside, but it didn't get in the way of sleep, and I actually enjoyed hearing the city. The closet and drawers were surprisingly spacious. The room itself is under an electricity control where you place a card on your keyring into a reader, and the electrical service is available; if the key is taken out after a minute or so the power goes out. That was a good way to ensure energy efficiency, and it took a little getting used to. The electrical control box is mounted on the wall, and it did put out a buzzing sound. The location of the hotel is excellent - 5 minutes' walk and I was standing in St. Peter's Square, 10 minutes' walk and I was at Castell San Angelo (you really need to see it - I didn't see a lot on it in the guidebooks, but the grounds are beautiful, you can walk around it in a park area, and it is a great looking building), 5 minutes away were a few good restaurants, three minutes away and you were in a great shopping district. It takes about 8-10 minutes to walk from the hotel to the Metro station, and the bus stop is basically across the street about a block up, so getting around from there wasn't a bad experience at all. If you prefer, there is also a trolley station about 4-5 minutes away. The neighborhood around the hotel is largely residential, and there wasn't a lot of foot traffic right there, so walking down the sidewalk was easily done, and it was a nice route to take of an early evening. I noticed a lack of the graffiti that is plaguing Rome these days, and that speaks well of the neighborhood as far as preserving their streets and keeping them nice. The bottom line is that this hotel is a great place to stay for 50-100 Euros less than other hotels. If you must insist on the creature comforts, and you feel uncomfortable with not having a large room, this is not a good fit for you. If you are looking for a nice, safe place to stay that is near what you want, buon giorno! I do not recommend this hotel for a larger family, simply because there are no rooms large enough for them. If they wanted to split to different rooms, though, it would be fine. What I liked best: Location, staff What I liked least: The wireless connectivity wasn't great, the buzz from the electrical box took a bit to get used to.

Reviews.Title: “Best location, value and service of any other hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: anniemacBoston_Ma
Reviews.Content: This is a hidden gem...just a block from St. Peter's, very friendly staff and beautiful rooms...would could go back in a heartbeat

Reviews.Title: “We ended up here by chance, but fortune was smiling on us”
Reviews.Author: teamfur
Reviews.Content: I had booked a room at a different hotel in the area, but after we arrived at that hotel and waited several hours for our room to become available, we were taken to "a different room." It turns out that the room was not only different, it was at a different hotel, the Hotel Prati. We were exhausted and laden with luggage for a 3 week trip, and tings looked pretty sad at first, but Fabio and Luigi patiently put us up. After a long nap, life began to look better. So much better that we didn;t go back to the 1st hotel as we were supposed to, but stayed at the Prati. And I would stay here again anytime! Yes, the rooms are small, but it is a 2 star hotel, and I didn;t come to Rome to stay in my room. The bath is small but well equipped. The shower is fantastic. The small bars of soap worked fine, as did the envelopes of shampoo. The linen towels did their job. And the beds are fantastically comfortable. The air conditioner works beautifully, and there is a nice cross ventilation if you choose to turn off the air conditioner and sleep with the windows open. We were lulled to sleep by the sounds of the city. The location is perfect. We are within easy walking distance of Vatican City, Castel San Angelo, and the Burgo. The Piazza Navonna is not far by foot. The desk staff are patient (beyond belief!), diplomatic, friendly and helpful. They delight in helping me with my Italian, and really rescued us from a very difficult situation. We found the hotel by accident, but I would come back in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “A delightful stay!”
Reviews.Author: ebbailey
Reviews.Content: I spent 7 excellent days at Hotel Prati. A number of things stand out from this experience. First to be highlighted, was the very warm and professional service from the entire staff. I always felt at home and well supported when I need guidance or assistance. Second, the room was very pleasant, exceptionally clean, and cozy (but well designed to make the most of limited space.) It had comfortable beds, towels refreshed daily, a great air conditioning system, a nice audio system for the rooms, sound proofed windows (which I know worked well as I was on the first level.) The Internet connection is free, and the hotel provides two comfortable lounge areas as well as a work center with two computer stations. This hotel is an excellent value for the money, has a lift, is in a very convenient and safe location just a few blocks to public transport, the Vatican, and good shopping streets. A number of coffee "bars" are quite close where one can have breakfast, and some very good restaurants are steps away.

Reviews.Title: “Brand New mid range clean & friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kolhapuri
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in may 09. Newly renovated, clean and friendly hotel. The staff are co-operative and professional. Located very close to Vatican and near the Metro. Good food around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Skeddadle
Reviews.Content: We found the Prati a good value. It is very, very clean. It is only a few blocks from the Vatican and within walking distance of most of the sites of Rome. Good dining is a fairly short walk away. Super friendly and helpful front desk staff. Excellent Internet connection with two terminals. The operative word for the hotel is small, though. The elevator holds two - if they are embracing. The rooms are fairly small. The baths appear to be newly renovated, but they are small and lack a place to put toiletries, etc. The shower stall is very small. A couple of caveats - the only toiletry supplied was a small bar of soap. Also, they supposedly have hairdriers at the desk. However, we were only able to get one for 1 of 3 showers. Recommend adopting a hairstyle that doesn't require drying or bringing your own.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good price and location”
Reviews.Author: nevada17
Reviews.Content: I gave this hotel above average, b/c of the location, staff and free internet in the lobby. The rooms were very clean... a little small, but thats to be expected in a big city. The bathroom was very new and clean. The price was the selling point for this hotel, but in our trip to Italy... this was one of the better hotels... just mins from the Vatican city. I would stay here again and recommended it to travelers on a budget. Also, the rooms have windows that completely lock out any sound from the busy streets... definitely a plus if you would like to sleep in.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: CanadaManitoba
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Prati for a number of days and found some of things others have said to be true, though not problematic... Towels were linen rather than terry, though staff provided terry upon request. Both did the job. For the record, I encountered the same linens in Venice in a more expensive hotel, so this is clearly not something unique to this hotel. Restaurant was under construction, but discount was given, and information was provided upon arrival (rather than as a surprise upon check-out). Breakfasts of cappacino and croissents and other pastries were available at a number of cafes less than 1/2 block away. Hotel location was fabulous - walking distance to the Vatican, from the train station, etc. The staff were the friendliest, most helpful people that I came across in all of Rome, Florence, and Venice combined. They provided accurate directions to various destinations, and numerous ways to save money and hassles. Their customer service was very much appreciated. Looking at some criticisms, I must conclude that many people are frustrated if they travel outside of their country and find things done differently than at home. One must wonder what such individuals are doing travelling at all! Remember the old adage - when in Rome!...

Reviews.Title: “wonderful Prati”
Reviews.Author: malo58
Reviews.Content: I would like to express my satisfaction in staying in this small but very nice hotel. First its position: so close to the Vatican City and also to the shopping area of Via Cola di Rienzo with many fancy shops. Also the management simply perfect, helpful and kind. Rooms are tidy and clean. I was really happy to spend my week in Rome with the Prati Hotel staff! thank you again. pat from zurich

Reviews.Title: “A great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: cameraguy52
Reviews.Content: Hotel Prati - Rome, Italy December 11 - 18, 2007 This is a small style hotel with small rooms. I was traveling alone visiting my son his last week at college (study abroad program). When I say small I mean small. But, it was perfect. No need for room when you are by yourself. I stayed there for 4 days in the single room. Then when my son was finished with his semester he moved in with me and we upgraded into a two bed room. It was fine for our needs. We had a slight medical emergency and the hotel staff was more than helpful helping us get in touch with a doctor at midnight. The location is fine for walking to any of your standard tourist spots in Rome. Also, there is a bus stop not far from the hotel which is helpful when you get the hang of the bus system. The Metro is not far away either. All in all I was very satisfied with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location - feels like family”
Reviews.Author: Coolbeat
Reviews.Content: The hotel Prati is a great value for the money! It is NOT the most comfortable hotel if you plan to spend a lot of time in a large, comfortable room - but then, there is so much to see and do in Rome, that we only used the hotel to sleep in between our many outings. The location is fantastic - one can walk to most of Rome's major attractions - and if you want to go a bit futher away, the Metro (subway) is located within a less than 10min leisurely walk from the hotel. Shortfalls: the rooms are very, very small as well as the bathrooms - but, all is clean and well maintained. There is a new elevator (lift) installed which makes moving the luggage quite comfortable. The "towels" used in the bathrooms are "Italian style" which to some travellers made feel odd. They are very absorbant thin sheets of cotton similar to a bedsheet - so don't expect the usual thick, soft, plushy hoteltowels. IF you book a double room - do not expect ONE bed (such as American King size or Queen size) - but simply two twin beds pushed together. The location as great as it is - maybe a bit noisy at times (major intersection) - but during late-night (sleeping time) it's very quiet and fine. The staff is very helpful - especially Franco who helped us much! They speak reasonably good English which also helps a lot when having questions about trips and attractions etc. Highly recommend you see the Sistine Chappell and the Vatican Museum - and of course St. Peters Cathedral - all just minutes walking distance from this hotel. Major other attractions such as the Trevi Fountain, the Spanish Steps and the Panthenon are within about 20-30min leisurely walk from the hotel. The Collosseum and Forum Romanum/Circus Maximus is about a 20min ride on the subway.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: mermaid086
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Prati in Aug. 2007. The rooms are average sized except for the bathroom which is claustrophobic. It is difficult for 2 persons to be in the bathroom at the same time. The shower had a curtain but still there was almost a flood after showering. For two days we didn’t even have hot water. Towels are horrible. Some of the furniture should also be updated. The room is well equipped with a mini bar, tv, fan and a safe deposit box The breakfast is AWFUL!!!! Do not choose this hotel because breakfast is included in the price. We had to go out and buy breakfast because the breakfast at Prati was so limited. Hotel Prati is close to many attractions, but the hotel is overpriced. Our stay was not what I had expected.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Prati
HotelInfo.Address: Via Crescenzio, 89 | New Management, 00193 Rome, Italy
